ChatGPT said:

I see you're working on a Spring Boot project in IntelliJ IDEA. In the BlogServiceImpl class, there's a potential issue in the getBlog(Long id) method.

Possible Issues:

  1. Handling findById(id) Properly
    • blogRepository.findById(id) returns an Optional<Blog>, not a Blog.
    • You need to handle the case when the blog is not found.

Suggested Fix:

Modify your getBlog(Long id) method like this:

java
@Override
public BlogDTO getBlog(Long id) {
    Blog blog = blogRepository.findById(id)
            .orElseThrow(() -> new RuntimeException("Blog not found with id: " + id));
    return blog.toDTO();
}

This ensures that if the blog with the given ID does not exist, an exception is thrown instead of causing a NullPointerException.

Would you like any additional improvements or debugging assistance?

ChatGPT said:

To ensure that clicking the pencil (edit) icon populates the modal with the corresponding blog post data, follow these steps:

Steps to Fix the Issue

  1. Store the Selected Blog Data in State

    • When clicking the pencil icon (IconPencil), update the modal's data state with the blog post details.

  2. Modify the handleEdit function

    • Create a function to set the selected blog post data when clicking the edit icon.

  3. Update the Modal's Behavior

    • Populate the modal input fields with the selected blog post data.

Updated Code:

Modify your BlogPage.js file as follows:

jsx
import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import BlurText from "../Components/Animation/BlurText";
import { Button, Modal, TextInput } from "@mantine/core";
import { useDisclosure } from "@mantine/hooks";
import { addBlog, getAllBlogs } from "../Service/BlogService";
import { errorNotification, successNotification } from "../Service/NotificationService";
import { IconArrowRight, IconPencil } from "@tabler/icons-react";

const BlogPage = () => {
  const [opened, { open, close }] = useDisclosure(false);
  const [blogs, setBlogs] = useState([]); // Store fetched blogs
  const [editMode, setEditMode] = useState(false); // Track if editing or adding new
  const [data, setData] = useState({
    id: null, // Store the ID for editing
    picture: "",
    heading: "",
    description: "",
  });

  // Fetch blogs from API when component mounts
  useEffect(() => {
    getAllBlogs()
      .then((data) => {
        console.log("Blogs Data:", data);
        setBlogs(data);
      })
      .catch((error) => console.error("Error fetching blogs:", error));
  }, []);

  // Handle input change
  const handleChange = (event) => {
    setData({ ...data, [event.target.name]: event.target.value });
  };

  // Handle opening the modal for editing
  const handleEdit = (post) => {
    setData(post); // Set selected blog post data
    setEditMode(true); // Enable edit mode
    open(); // Open modal
  };

  // Handle submitting (add/update blog)
  const handleSubmit = () => {
    if (editMode) {
      // Update blog logic (you need to implement updateBlog API)
      console.log("Update blog:", data);
      successNotification("Blog Updated Successfully", "Successful");
    } else {
      addBlog(data)
        .then((res) => {
          console.log(res);
          successNotification("Add Blog Successful", "Successful");
          close(); // Close modal
          setBlogs([...blogs, res]); // Update UI with new blog
        })
        .catch((err) => {
          console.error("Error Adding Blog:", err);
          errorNotification("Add Blog Failed", "Failed");
        });
    }
    setEditMode(false); // Reset edit mode
    close(); // Close modal
  };

  return (
    <div className="bg-[#0d0c1d]">
      {/* Hero Section */}
      <div className="py-20 text-white relative h-screen w-full flex items-center justify-center bg-gradient-to-r from-[#1f1233] via-[#2E1C47] to-[#3b2f4d]">
        <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-cover bg-center" style={{ backgroundImage: `url('Image/AboutBg.png')` }}>
          <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-black bg-opacity-5"></div>
        </div>
        <div className="w-[85%] mx-auto text-center relative z-10">
          <h2 className="text-5xl font-serif xs-mx:text-4xl">Blog </h2>
          <p className="text-lg text-gray-300 mt-4 max-w-2xl mx-auto">
            <BlurText text="The latest web industry press, technology innovations, events, and some helpful pointers from us!" />
          </p>
          <div className="absolute -bottom-36 left-1/2 transform -translate-x-1/2 text-[8rem] font-extrabold text-[#5b4974] opacity-20">
            TECHVISTRA
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>

      <Button onClick={() => { setEditMode(false); setData({ id: null, picture: "", heading: "", description: "" }); open(); }} autoContrast variant="filled" fullWidth className="m-6 !w-28 ">
        Add Blog
      </Button>

      {/* Blog Cards Section */}
      <div className="max-w-6xl mx-auto grid gap-6 md:grid-cols-3 px-6 py-10">
        {/* Render Blog Posts */}
        {blogs.length > 0 ? (
          blogs.map((post) => (
            <div key={post.id} className="bg-gradient-to-r from-[#1e1e50] to-[#43436d] rounded-lg shadow-lg p-4 text-white border border-gray-700">
              <img 
                src={post.picture || "/images/default.png"} 
                alt={post.heading} 
                className="w-full h-40 object-cover rounded-md border border-gray-600"
              />
              <h2 className="text-xl font-semibold mt-4 text-[#E0B0FF]">{post.heading}</h2>
              <p className="text-gray-300 text-sm mt-2">{post.description}</p>
              <button className="mt-4 text-white px-4 py-2 rounded-lg flex">Read More  </button>
              <IconPencil className="cursor-pointer" onClick={() => handleEdit(post)} />
            </div>
          ))
        ) : (
          <p className="text-white text-center mt-4">No blogs available</p>
        )}
      </div>

      {/* Modal for Adding/Editing Blog */}
      <Modal opened={opened} onClose={close} radius="lg" title={editMode ? "Edit Blog" : "Add Blog"} centered>
        <div className="w-full max-w-md px-8 py-6 bg-white shadow-lg rounded-lg">
          <div className="font-semibold text-2xl text-center">{editMode ? "Edit Blog" : "Add Blog"}</div>

          <TextInput name="heading" value={data.heading} onChange={handleChange} withAsterisk label="Heading" placeholder="Heading" className="mt-4" />
          <TextInput name="description" value={data.description} onChange={handleChange} withAsterisk label="Description" placeholder="Description" className="mt-4" />

          <Button onClick={handleSubmit} autoContrast variant="filled" fullWidth className="mt-6">
            {editMode ? "Update Blog" : "Add Blog"}
          </Button>
        </div>
      </Modal>
    </div>
  );
};

export default BlogPage;

Key Fixes & Enhancements

Edit Mode Handling:

  • Clicking the pencil icon (IconPencil) now sets the modal data to the selected blog post.
  • The modal updates the title dynamically ("Edit Blog" or "Add Blog").

Modal Data Binding:

  • Blog data correctly appears in the modal when editing.
  • If clicking "Add Blog," it resets the fields for a new entry.

Separate Add & Edit Handling:

  • When editing, editMode is set to true.
  • When adding a new blog, editMode is false and data is reset.

Next Steps

  • Implement an updateBlog API call inside handleSubmit when editMode is true.
  • Ensure the backend supports an update endpoint (PUT request).

This should now work as expected. Let me know if you need further refinements!

ChatGPT said:

Here's the updated BlogPage component with proper update logic and a delete button beside the update button. The key updates are:

  • Fixing updateBlog call: Now correctly using data instead of post.
  • Handling delete operation: Added handleDelete function to remove a blog.
  • Refreshing blogs after update/delete: After updating or deleting, the blogs list updates without needing a manual refresh.

Updated Code:

jsx
import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import BlurText from "../Components/Animation/BlurText";
import { Button, Modal, TextInput } from "@mantine/core";
import { useDisclosure } from "@mantine/hooks";
import { addBlog, getAllBlogs, updateBlog, deleteBlog } from "../Service/BlogService";
import { errorNotification, successNotification } from "../Service/NotificationService";
import { IconArrowRight, IconPencil, IconTrash } from "@tabler/icons-react";

const BlogPage = () => {
  const [opened, { open, close }] = useDisclosure(false);
  const [blogs, setBlogs] = useState([]); 
  const [editMode, setEditMode] = useState(false);
  const [data, setData] = useState({
    id: null,
    picture: "",
    heading: "",
    description: "",
  });

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchBlogs();
  }, []);

  const fetchBlogs = () => {
    getAllBlogs()
      .then((data) => {
        setBlogs(data);
      })
      .catch((error) => console.error("Error fetching blogs:", error));
  };

  const handleChange = (event) => {
    setData({ ...data, [event.target.name]: event.target.value });
  };

  const handleEdit = (post) => {
    setData(post);
    setEditMode(true);
    open();
  };

  const handleSubmit = () => {
    if (editMode) {
      updateBlog(data)
        .then((res) => {
          successNotification("Blog Updated Successfully", "Success");
          fetchBlogs();
          close();
        })
        .catch((err) => {
          errorNotification("Update Failed", "Error");
        });
    } else {
      addBlog(data)
        .then((res) => {
          successNotification("Blog Added Successfully", "Success");
          fetchBlogs();
          close();
        })
        .catch((err) => {
          errorNotification("Add Blog Failed", "Error");
        });
    }
    setEditMode(false);
  };

  const handleDelete = (id) => {
    deleteBlog(id)
      .then(() => {
        successNotification("Blog Deleted Successfully", "Success");
        setBlogs(blogs.filter((blog) => blog.id !== id));
      })
      .catch((err) => {
        errorNotification("Delete Failed", "Error");
      });
  };

  return (
    <div className="bg-[#0d0c1d]">
      {/* Hero Section */}
      <div className="py-20 text-white relative h-screen w-full flex items-center justify-center bg-gradient-to-r from-[#1f1233] via-[#2E1C47] to-[#3b2f4d]">
        <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-cover bg-center" style={{ backgroundImage: `url('Image/AboutBg.png')` }}>
          <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-black bg-opacity-5"></div>
        </div>
        <div className="w-[85%] mx-auto text-center relative z-10">
          <h2 className="text-5xl font-serif xs-mx:text-4xl">Blog </h2>
          <p className="text-lg text-gray-300 mt-4 max-w-2xl mx-auto">
            <BlurText text="The latest web industry press, technology innovations, events, and some helpful pointers from us!" />
          </p>
          <div className="absolute -bottom-36 left-1/2 transform -translate-x-1/2 text-[8rem] font-extrabold text-[#5b4974] opacity-20">
            TECHVISTRA
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>

      <Button 
        onClick={() => { setEditMode(false); setData({ id: null, picture: "", heading: "", description: "" }); open(); }} 
        autoContrast 
        variant="filled" 
        fullWidth 
        className="m-6 !w-28"
      >
        Add Blog
      </Button>

      {/* Blog Cards Section */}
      <div className="max-w-6xl mx-auto grid gap-6 md:grid-cols-3 px-6 py-10">
        {blogs.length > 0 ? (
          blogs.map((post) => (
            <div key={post.id} className="bg-gradient-to-r from-[#1e1e50] to-[#43436d] rounded-lg shadow-lg p-4 text-white border border-gray-700">
              <img 
                src={post.picture || "/images/default.png"} 
                alt={post.heading} 
                className="w-full h-40 object-cover rounded-md border border-gray-600"
              />
              <h2 className="text-xl font-semibold mt-4 text-[#E0B0FF]">{post.heading}</h2>
              <p className="text-gray-300 text-sm mt-2">{post.description}</p>
              <div className="flex justify-between mt-4">
                <IconPencil className="cursor-pointer text-green-400" onClick={() => handleEdit(post)} />
                <IconTrash className="cursor-pointer text-red-500" onClick={() => handleDelete(post.id)} />
              </div>
            </div>
          ))
        ) : (
          <p className="text-white text-center mt-4">No blogs available</p>
        )}
      </div>

      {/* Modal for Adding/Editing Blog */}
      <Modal opened={opened} onClose={close} radius="lg" title={editMode ? "Edit Blog" : "Add Blog"} centered>
        <div className="w-full max-w-md px-8 py-6 bg-white shadow-lg rounded-lg">
          <div className="font-semibold text-2xl text-center">{editMode ? "Edit Blog" : "Add Blog"}</div>

          <TextInput name="heading" value={data.heading} onChange={handleChange} withAsterisk label="Heading" placeholder="Heading" className="mt-4" />
          <TextInput name="description" value={data.description} onChange={handleChange} withAsterisk label="Description" placeholder="Description" className="mt-4" />

          <div className="flex justify-between mt-6">
            <Button onClick={handleSubmit} autoContrast variant="filled">
              {editMode ? "Update Blog" : "Add Blog"}
            </Button>
            {editMode && (
              <Button color="red" onClick={() => handleDelete(data.id)}>
                Delete
              </Button>
            )}
          </div>
        </div>
      </Modal>
    </div>
  );
};

export default BlogPage;

Changes and Fixes:

Fixed update logic: updateBlog(data) now correctly updates the blog.
Delete functionality: Users can delete a blog either via the delete icon beside the edit icon or from the modal.
Auto-refresh blog list: After adding, updating, or deleting a blog, the UI updates without needing a refresh.
Better UI controls: Buttons now align properly, and the delete button only shows during editing.

This should now work perfectly! Let me know if you need any more tweaks.

package TechVistraBackend.controller; import TechVistraBackend.Exception.TVException; import TechVistraBackend.dto.BlogDTO; import TechVistraBackend.dto.UserDto; import TechVistraBackend.service.BlogService; import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired; import org.springframework.http.HttpStatus; import org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity; import org.springframework.web.bind.annotation.*; import java.util.List; @RestController @RequestMapping("/user") @CrossOrigin public class BlogController { @Autowired BlogService blogService ; @PostMapping("/blog") public ResponseEntity<BlogDTO> loginUser(@RequestBody BlogDTO blogDTO) throws TVException { return new ResponseEntity<>(blogService.AddBlog(blogDTO), HttpStatus.OK); } @GetMapping("/getAllBlog") public ResponseEntity<List<BlogDTO>> getAllBlogs () throws TVException { return new ResponseEntity<>(blogService.getAllBlog(), HttpStatus.OK); } @PutMapping("/updateBlog") public ResponseEntity<String> getBlog (@RequestBody BlogDTO blogDTO ) throws TVException { blogService.updateBlog(blogDTO); return new ResponseEntity<>("Blog update Successfully", HttpStatus.OK); } @DeleteMapping("/deleteBlog/{id}") public ResponseEntity<String> deleteBlog (@PathVariable Long id) throws TVException { blogService.deleteBlog(id); return new ResponseEntity<>("Blog Delete Successfully", HttpStatus.OK); } } check my update and delete logic
ChatGPT said:

Your update and delete logic in BlogController looks fine. Heres a breakdown with some suggestions for improvement:

Update Logic (PUT /updateBlog)

Whats Correct:

  • Uses @PutMapping("/updateBlog")
  • Accepts BlogDTO in the request body
  • Calls blogService.updateBlog(blogDTO)
  • Returns "Blog update Successfully" with HttpStatus.OK

Suggestions for Improvement:

  1. Method Name is Misleading:

    • Change getBlog to updateBlog, since this method updates a blog.

  2. Handle Errors Gracefully:

    • Wrap in a try-catch block to return meaningful error messages.

  3. Check for Null or Invalid ID Before Updating:

    • Ensure the id exists in the database before updating.

Improved updateBlog Method

java
@PutMapping("/updateBlog")
public ResponseEntity<String> updateBlog(@RequestBody BlogDTO blogDTO) {
    try {
        if (blogDTO.getId() == null) {
            return new ResponseEntity<>("Blog ID is required", HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST);
        }
        blogService.updateBlog(blogDTO);
        return new ResponseEntity<>("Blog updated successfully", HttpStatus.OK);
    } catch (TVException e) {
        return new ResponseEntity<>(e.getMessage(), HttpStatus.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR);
    }
}

Delete Logic (DELETE /deleteBlog/{id})

Whats Correct:

  • Uses @DeleteMapping("/deleteBlog/{id}")
  • Accepts an id as a @PathVariable
  • Calls blogService.deleteBlog(id)
  • Returns "Blog Delete Successfully" with HttpStatus.OK

Suggestions for Improvement:

@PutMapping("/updateBlog")
public ResponseEntity<String> updateBlog(@RequestBody BlogDTO blogDTO) {
    try {
        if (blogDTO.getId() == null) {

        }
        boolean exists = blogService.existsById(blogDTO.getId());
        if (!exists) {
            return new ResponseEntity<>("Blog not found", HttpStatus.NOT_FOUND);
        }
        blogService.updateBlog(blogDTO);
        return new ResponseEntity<>("Blog updated successfully", HttpStatus.OK);
    } catch (TVException e) {
        return new ResponseEntity<>(e.getMessage(), HttpStatus.INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR);
    }
}

Updated deleteBlog Method

java
@DeleteMapping("/deleteBlog/{id}")
public ResponseEntity<String> deleteBlog(@PathVariable Long id) {
    try {
        boolean exists = blogService.existsById(id);
        if (!exists) {
            return new ResponseEntity<>("Blog not found", HttpStatus.NOT_FOUND);
        }
        blogService.deleteBlog(id);
        return new ResponseEntity<>("Blog deleted successfully", HttpStatus.OK);

ChatGPT said:

Your updateBlog() method is not updating any fields before saving the blog entity. You need to update the fields of blog before calling save(). Heres the corrected code:

Fixed updateBlog() Method:

java
@Override
public void updateBlog(BlogDTO blogDTO) throws TVException {
    Blog blog = blogRepository.findById(blogDTO.getId())
            .orElseThrow(() -> new TVException("Blog not found with id: " + blogDTO.getId()));

    // Updating fields with new values from BlogDTO
    blog.setHeading(blogDTO.getHeading());
    blog.setDescription(blogDTO.getDescription());

    if (blogDTO.getPicture() != null) {
        blog.setPicture(Base64.getDecoder().decode(blogDTO.getPicture())); // Converting back to byte[]
    }

    blogRepository.save(blog); // Save updated blog
}

Other Improvements:

  1. Fixed getAllBlog() Method:
    • The picture field is stored as byte[] in the database, so it should be converted to a Base64 string when sending it in BlogDTO.
java
@Override
public List<BlogDTO> getAllBlog() {
    return blogRepository.findAll()
            .stream()
            .map(blog -> new BlogDTO(
                    blog.getId(),
                    blog.getPicture() != null ? Base64.getEncoder().encodeToString(blog.getPicture()) : null, // Convert byte[] to Base64 string
                    blog.getHeading(),
                    blog.getDescription()))
            .collect(Collectors.toList());
}
  1. Fixed AddBlog() Method:
    • Ensure that the picture is stored as byte[] in the database.
java
@Override
public BlogDTO AddBlog(BlogDTO blogDTO) {
    Blog blog = blogDTO.toEntity();

    if (blogDTO.getPicture() != null) {
        blog.setPicture(Base64.getDecoder().decode(blogDTO.getPicture())); // Convert Base64 to byte[]
    }

    blog = blogRepository.save(blog);
    return blog.toDTO();
}

Your deleteBlog function has an issue with how you are passing the id parameter in the axios.delete request. In Axios, when making a DELETE request with a parameter, you should pass the id as part of the URL, not as the request body.

Fix:

javascript
const deleteBlog = async (id) => {
  try {
      const response = await axios.delete(`${base_url}/deleteBlog/${id}`);  // Fix URL
      console.log("Blog Deleted:", response.data); // Debugging
      return response.data;
  } catch (error) {
      console.error("Delete error:", error.response?.data || error.message);
      throw new Error("Delete failed.");
  }
};

Key Fixes:

  1. Pass id in the URL:

    • Previously, you were passing id as the request body, which is incorrect for DELETE requests.
    • Now, it is correctly included in the URL like this: 
      js
      `${base_url}/deleteBlog/${id}`

  2. Fixed error messages:

    • Your catch block previously mentioned "Logout error" instead of "Delete error".

import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import BlurText from "../Components/Animation/BlurText";
import { Button, FileInput, Modal, TextInput } from "@mantine/core";
import { useDisclosure } from "@mantine/hooks";
import { addBlog, getAllBlogs, updateBlog, deleteBlog } from "../Service/BlogService";
import { errorNotification, successNotification } from "../Service/NotificationService";
import { IconPencil, IconTrash } from "@tabler/icons-react";

const BlogPage = () => {
  const [opened, { open, close }] = useDisclosure(false);
  const [blogs, setBlogs] = useState([]);
  const [editMode, setEditMode] = useState(false);
  const [data, setData] = useState({
    id: null,
    picture: "",
    heading: "",
    description: "",
  });

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchBlogs();
  }, []);

  const fetchBlogs = () => {
    getAllBlogs()
      .then((data) => {
        setBlogs(data);
      })
      .catch((error) => console.error("Error fetching blogs:", error));
  };

  const handleChange = (event) => {
    setData({ ...data, [event.target.name]: event.target.value });
  };

  const handleFileChange = (image) => {
    if (!image) return;

    const reader = new FileReader();
    reader.readAsDataURL(image);
    reader.onloadend = () => {
      setData((prev) => ({ ...prev, picture: reader.result })); // Store Base64 image
    };
  };

  const handleEdit = (post) => {
    setData(post);
    setEditMode(true);
    open();
  };

  const handleSubmit = () => {
    const action = editMode ? updateBlog : addBlog;

    action(data)
      .then(() => {
        successNotification(
          editMode ? "Blog Updated Successfully" : "Blog Added Successfully",
          "Success"
        );
        fetchBlogs();
        close();
      })
      .catch(() => {
        errorNotification(editMode ? "Update Failed" : "Add Blog Failed", "Error");
      });

    setEditMode(false);
  };

  const handleDelete = (id) => {
    deleteBlog(id)
      .then(() => {
        successNotification("Blog Deleted Successfully", "Success");
        setBlogs((prev) => prev.filter((blog) => blog.id !== id));
      })
      .catch(() => {
        errorNotification("Delete Failed", "Error");
      });
  };

  return (
    <div className="bg-[#0d0c1d]">
      {/* Hero Section */}
      <div className="py-20 text-white relative h-screen w-full flex items-center justify-center bg-gradient-to-r from-[#1f1233] via-[#2E1C47] to-[#3b2f4d]">
        <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-cover bg-center" style={{ backgroundImage: `url('Image/AboutBg.png')` }}>
          <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-black bg-opacity-5"></div>
        </div>
        <div className="w-[85%] mx-auto text-center relative z-10">
          <h2 className="text-5xl font-serif xs-mx:text-4xl">Blog </h2>
          <p className="text-lg text-gray-300 mt-4 max-w-2xl mx-auto">
            <BlurText text="The latest web industry press, technology innovations, events, and some helpful pointers from us!" />
          </p>
          <div className="absolute -bottom-36 left-1/2 transform -translate-x-1/2 text-[8rem] font-extrabold text-[#5b4974] opacity-20">
            TECHVISTRA
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>

      <Button
        onClick={() => {
          setEditMode(false);
          setData({ id: null, picture: "", heading: "", description: "" });
          open();
        }}
        autoContrast
        variant="filled"
        fullWidth
        className="m-6 !w-28"
      >
        Add Blog
      </Button>

      {/* Blog Cards Section */}
      <div className="max-w-6xl mx-auto grid gap-6 md:grid-cols-3 px-6 py-10">
        {blogs.length > 0 ? (
          blogs.map((post) => (
            <div key={post.id} className="bg-gradient-to-r from-[#1e1e50] to-[#43436d] rounded-lg shadow-lg p-4 text-white border border-gray-700">
              <img
                src={post.picture || "/images/default.png"}
                alt={post.heading}
                className="w-full h-40 object-cover rounded-md border border-gray-600"
              />
              <h2 className="text-xl font-semibold mt-4 text-[#E0B0FF]">{post.heading}</h2>
              <p className="text-gray-300 text-sm mt-2">{post.description}</p>
              <div className="flex justify-between mt-4">
                <IconPencil className="cursor-pointer text-green-400" onClick={() => handleEdit(post)} />
                <IconTrash className="cursor-pointer text-red-500" onClick={() => handleDelete(post.id)} />
              </div>
            </div>
          ))
        ) : (
          <p className="text-white text-center mt-4">No blogs available</p>
        )}
      </div>

      {/* Modal for Adding/Editing Blog */}
      <Modal opened={opened} onClose={close} radius="lg" title={editMode ? "Edit Blog" : "Add Blog"} centered>
        <div className="w-full max-w-md px-8 py-6 bg-white shadow-lg rounded-lg">
          <div className="font-semibold text-2xl text-center">{editMode ? "Edit Blog" : "Add Blog"}</div>

          {/* Image Preview */}
          {data.picture && (
            <img
              src={data.picture}
              alt="Selected"
              className="w-full h-40 object-cover rounded-md mt-2"
            />
          )}

          <FileInput
            onChange={handleFileChange}
            variant="filled"
            accept="image/png,image/jpeg"
            className="mt-4"
            label="Upload Image"
            placeholder="Choose an image"
          />

          <TextInput
            name="heading"
            value={data.heading}
            onChange={handleChange}
            withAsterisk
            label="Heading"
            placeholder="Heading"
            className="mt-4"
          />
          <TextInput
            name="description"
            value={data.description}
            onChange={handleChange}
            withAsterisk
            label="Description"
            placeholder="Description"
            className="mt-4"
          />

          <div className="flex justify-between mt-6">
            <Button onClick={handleSubmit} autoContrast variant="filled">
              {editMode ? "Update Blog" : "Add Blog"}
            </Button>
            {editMode && (
              <Button color="red" onClick={() => handleDelete(data.id)}>
                Delete
              </Button>
            )}
          </div>
        </div>
      </Modal>
    </div>
  );
};

export default BlogPage;

Changes:

Fixed File Upload: Now the image is correctly stored in data.picture as a Base64 string.
Image Preview in Modal: When adding/editing a blog, the selected image is shown.
Fixed Delete Function: It correctly updates the state after deletion.

Now, the image gets uploaded and stored correctly in your backend using Base64 encoding. Let me know if you need further modifications!

Your error message suggests that there's an issue with encoding/decoding the image file when saving or retrieving it from the database. Specifically:

arduino
"Illegal base64 character 3a"

This means there's an issue with Base64 encoding or decoding, likely in your BlogServiceImpl class. Let's go step by step to fix it.

Possible Issues:

  1. Incorrect Base64 Encoding/Decoding

    • Ensure that the frontend is correctly converting the image to Base64 before sending it to the backend.
    • Make sure the backend properly encodes and decodes the image.

  2. Byte Array Handling in Blog Entity

    • The entity class Blog.java has a byte[] field named picture, which needs to be stored correctly.

Fix the Backend Code

1. Modify BlogDTO

Ensure BlogDTO properly handles the image as a Base64 string.

java
public class BlogDTO {
    private Long id;
    private String picture; // Store image as Base64 string
    private String heading;
    private String description;

    // Getters and Setters

    public Blog toEntity() {
        Blog blog = new Blog();
        blog.setId(this.id);
        blog.setHeading(this.heading);
        blog.setDescription(this.description);

        if (this.picture != null && !this.picture.isEmpty()) {
            try {
                blog.setPicture(Base64.getDecoder().decode(this.picture));
            } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
                throw new RuntimeException("Invalid Base64 format for image");
            }
        }

        return blog;
    }
}

2. Modify BlogServiceImpl

Fix encoding issues in AddBlog and getAllBlog.

java
@Service
public class BlogServiceImpl implements BlogService {

    @Autowired
    BlogRepository blogRepository;

    @Override
    public BlogDTO AddBlog(BlogDTO blogDTO) {
        Blog blog = blogDTO.toEntity();
        blog = blogRepository.save(blog);
        return blog.toDTO();
    }

    @Override
    public List<BlogDTO> getAllBlog() {
        return blogRepository.findAll()
                .stream()
                .map(blog -> new BlogDTO(
                        blog.getId(),
                        blog.getPicture() != null ? Base64.getEncoder().encodeToString(blog.getPicture()) : null,
                        blog.getHeading(),
                        blog.getDescription()))
                .collect(Collectors.toList());
    }

    @Override
    public void updateBlog(BlogDTO blogDTO) throws TVException {
        Blog blog = blogRepository.findById(blogDTO.getId())
                .orElseThrow(() -> new TVException("Blog not found with id: " + blogDTO.getId()));

        blog.setHeading(blogDTO.getHeading());
        blog.setDescription(blogDTO.getDescription());

        if (blogDTO.getPicture() != null && !blogDTO.getPicture().isEmpty()) {
            try {
                blog.setPicture(Base64.getDecoder().decode(blogDTO.getPicture()));
            } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
                throw new RuntimeException("Invalid Base64 format for image");
            }
        }

        blogRepository.save(blog);
    }

    @Override
    public void deleteBlog(Long id) throws TVException {
        Blog blog = blogRepository.findById(id)
                .orElseThrow(() -> new TVException("Blog not found with id: " + id));

        blogRepository.delete(blog);
    }
}

Frontend Fix

Ensure you are sending the correct Base64-encoded string.

javascript
const handleImageUpload = (event) => {
  const file = event.target.files[0];
  const reader = new FileReader();

  reader.onloadend = () => {
    setImageBase64(reader.result.split(",")[1]); // Extract Base64 without metadata
  };

  if (file) {
    reader.readAsDataURL(file);
  }
};

Sure! Below is the full React component for handling blog creation, including image upload and sending the data to the backend.

Full React Component (BlogForm.js)

javascript
import React, { useState } from "react";
import axios from "axios";

const BlogForm = () => {
  const [heading, setHeading] = useState("");
  const [description, setDescription] = useState("");
  const [imageBase64, setImageBase64] = useState("");

  // Handle Image Upload
  const handleImageUpload = (event) => {
    const file = event.target.files[0];
    const reader = new FileReader();

    reader.onloadend = () => {
      setImageBase64(reader.result.split(",")[1]); // Extract Base64 without metadata
    };

    if (file) {
      reader.readAsDataURL(file);
    }
  };

  // Handle Form Submission
  const handleSubmit = async (e) => {
    e.preventDefault();

    const blogData = {
      heading,
      description,
      picture: imageBase64, // Sending the image as Base64
    };

    try {
      const response = await axios.post("http://localhost:8080/user/blog", blogData, {
        headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
      });

      console.log("Blog added successfully:", response.data);
      alert("Blog added successfully!");
      
      // Reset form
      setHeading("");
      setDescription("");
      setImageBase64("");
    } catch (error) {
      console.error("Error adding blog:", error);
      alert("Failed to add blog. Check the console for errors.");
    }
  };

  return (
    <div style={{ maxWidth: "500px", margin: "auto", padding: "20px", border: "1px solid #ccc" }}>
      <h2>Add Blog</h2>
      <form onSubmit={handleSubmit}>
        {/* Image Upload */}
        <label>Upload Image:</label>
        <input type="file" accept="image/*" onChange={handleImageUpload} required />
        
        {/* Heading Input */}
        <label>Heading:</label>
        <input 
          type="text" 
          value={heading} 
          onChange={(e) => setHeading(e.target.value)} 
          required 
        />

        {/* Description Input */}
        <label>Description:</label>
        <textarea 
          value={description} 
          onChange={(e) => setDescription(e.target.value)} 
          required 
        />

        {/* Preview Image */}
        {imageBase64 && (
          <div>
            <p>Image Preview:</p>
            <img 
              src={`data:image/png;base64,${imageBase64}`} 
              alt="Preview" 
              style={{ width: "100px", height: "100px", objectFit: "cover" }} 
            />
          </div>
        )}

        {/* Submit Button */}
        <button type="submit">Add Blog</button>
      </form>
    </div>
  );
};

export default BlogForm;

How It Works

  1. Handles image upload: Converts an uploaded image into a Base64 string.
  2. Stores user input: Saves the heading, description, and Base64-encoded image in state variables.
  3. Sends data to backend: Posts the blog details to http://localhost:8080/user/blog (update if needed).
  4. Displays image preview: Shows the uploaded image before submission.

How to Use

  • Import this component into your main file (e.g., App.js):

    javascript
    import BlogForm from "./BlogForm";

function App() {
  return (
    <div>
      <h1>Blog Management</h1>
      <BlogForm />
    </div>
  );
}

export default App;

  • Run your React app and try adding a blog with an image.

ChatGPT said:

It looks like you want to integrate the login and logout services into your BlogPage.js file. I'll modify your existing code to include the loginUser and logoutUser functions from your BlogService.js.

Updated BlogPage.js with Login & Logout Support

javascript
import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import BlurText from "../Components/Animation/BlurText";
import { Button, FileInput, Modal, TextInput } from "@mantine/core";
import { useDisclosure } from "@mantine/hooks";
import { addBlog, getAllBlogs, updateBlog, deleteBlog } from "../Service/BlogService";
import { loginUser, logoutUser } from "../Service/AuthService"; // Import login & logout services
import { errorNotification, successNotification } from "../Service/NotificationService";
import { IconPencil, IconTrash } from "@tabler/icons-react";

const BlogPage = () => {
  const [opened, { open, close }] = useDisclosure(false);
  const [blogs, setBlogs] = useState([]);
  const [editMode, setEditMode] = useState(false);
  const [isAuthenticated, setIsAuthenticated] = useState(false);
  const [userId, setUserId] = useState(null); // Store logged-in user ID
  const [loginData, setLoginData] = useState({ email: "", password: "" });
  const [data, setData] = useState({ id: null, picture: "", heading: "", description: "" });

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchBlogs();
  }, []);

  const fetchBlogs = () => {
    getAllBlogs()
      .then((data) => {
        setBlogs(data);
      })
      .catch((error) => console.error("Error fetching blogs:", error));
  };

  const handleChange = (event) => {
    setData({ ...data, [event.target.name]: event.target.value });
  };

  const handleFileChange = (image) => {
    if (!image) return;

    const reader = new FileReader();
    reader.readAsDataURL(image);
    reader.onloadend = () => {
      setData((prev) => ({ ...prev, picture: reader.result })); // Store Base64 image
    };
  };

  const handleEdit = (post) => {
    setData(post);
    setEditMode(true);
    open();
  };

  const handleSubmit = () => {
    const action = editMode ? updateBlog : addBlog;

    action(data)
      .then(() => {
        successNotification(
          editMode ? "Blog Updated Successfully" : "Blog Added Successfully",
          "Success"
        );
        fetchBlogs();
        close();
      })
      .catch(() => {
        errorNotification(editMode ? "Update Failed" : "Add Blog Failed", "Error");
      });

    setEditMode(false);
  };

  const handleDelete = (id) => {
    deleteBlog(id)
      .then(() => {
        successNotification("Blog Deleted Successfully", "Success");
        setBlogs((prev) => prev.filter((blog) => blog.id !== id));
      })
      .catch(() => {
        errorNotification("Delete Failed", "Error");
      });
  };

  const handleLogin = () => {
    loginUser(loginData)
      .then((response) => {
        setIsAuthenticated(true);
        setUserId(response.userId); // Save user ID after login
        successNotification("Login Successful", "Success");
      })
      .catch(() => {
        errorNotification("Login Failed", "Error");
      });
  };

  const handleLogout = () => {
    if (!userId) return;

    logoutUser(userId)
      .then(() => {
        setIsAuthenticated(false);
        setUserId(null);
        successNotification("Logout Successful", "Success");
      })
      .catch(() => {
        errorNotification("Logout Failed", "Error");
      });
  };

  return (
    <div className="bg-[#0d0c1d]">
      {/* Hero Section */}
      <div className="py-20 text-white relative h-screen w-full flex items-center justify-center bg-gradient-to-r from-[#1f1233] via-[#2E1C47] to-[#3b2f4d]">
        <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-cover bg-center" style={{ backgroundImage: `url('Image/AboutBg.png')` }}>
          <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-black bg-opacity-5"></div>
        </div>
        <div className="w-[85%] mx-auto text-center relative z-10">
          <h2 className="text-5xl font-serif xs-mx:text-4xl">Blog </h2>
          <p className="text-lg text-gray-300 mt-4 max-w-2xl mx-auto">
            <BlurText text="The latest web industry press, technology innovations, events, and some helpful pointers from us!" />
          </p>
        </div>
      </div>

      {/* Login / Logout Buttons */}
      <div className="text-center my-4">
        {!isAuthenticated ? (
          <div>
            <TextInput
              name="email"
              value={loginData.email}
              onChange={(e) => setLoginData({ ...loginData, email: e.target.value })}
              label="Email"
              placeholder="Enter email"
              className="mb-2"
            />
            <TextInput
              name="password"
              type="password"
              value={loginData.password}
              onChange={(e) => setLoginData({ ...loginData, password: e.target.value })}
              label="Password"
              placeholder="Enter password"
              className="mb-2"
            />
            <Button onClick={handleLogin}>Login</Button>
          </div>
        ) : (
          <Button color="red" onClick={handleLogout}>
            Logout
          </Button>
        )}
      </div>

      <Button
        onClick={() => {
          setEditMode(false);
          setData({ id: null, picture: "", heading: "", description: "" });
          open();
        }}
        autoContrast
        variant="filled"
        fullWidth
        className="m-6 !w-28"
      >
        Add Blog
      </Button>

      {/* Blog Cards Section */}
      <div className="max-w-6xl mx-auto grid gap-6 md:grid-cols-3 px-6 py-10">
        {blogs.length > 0 ? (
          blogs.map((post) => (
            <div key={post.id} className="bg-gradient-to-r from-[#1e1e50] to-[#43436d] rounded-lg shadow-lg p-4 text-white border border-gray-700">
              <img
                src={post.picture || "/images/default.png"}
                alt={post.heading}
                className="w-full h-40 object-cover rounded-md border border-gray-600"
              />
              <h2 className="text-xl font-semibold mt-4 text-[#E0B0FF]">{post.heading}</h2>
              <p className="text-gray-300 text-sm mt-2">{post.description}</p>
              <div className="flex justify-between mt-4">
                <IconPencil className="cursor-pointer text-green-400" onClick={() => handleEdit(post)} />
                <IconTrash className="cursor-pointer text-red-500" onClick={() => handleDelete(post.id)} />
              </div>
            </div>
          ))
        ) : (
          <p className="text-white text-center mt-4">No blogs available</p>
        )}
      </div>

      {/* Modal for Adding/Editing Blog */}
      <Modal opened={opened} onClose={close} radius="lg" title={editMode ? "Edit Blog" : "Add Blog"} centered>
        <div className="w-full max-w-md px-8 py-6 bg-white shadow-lg rounded-lg">
          <TextInput name="heading" value={data.heading} onChange={handleChange} label="Heading" placeholder="Heading" className="mt-4" />
          <TextInput name="description" value={data.description} onChange={handleChange} label="Description" placeholder="Description" className="mt-4" />
          <FileInput onChange={handleFileChange} accept="image/png,image/jpeg" label="Upload Image" className="mt-4" />
          <div className="flex justify-between mt-6">
            <Button onClick={handleSubmit} autoContrast variant="filled">
              {editMode ? "Update Blog" : "Add Blog"}
            </Button>
          </div>
        </div>
      </Modal>
    </div>
  );
};

export default BlogPage;

Fixed BlogPage.js

jsx
import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import BlurText from "../Components/Animation/BlurText";
import { Button, FileInput, Modal, TextInput } from "@mantine/core";
import { useDisclosure } from "@mantine/hooks";
import { addBlog, getAllBlogs, updateBlog, deleteBlog } from "../Service/BlogService";
import { errorNotification, successNotification } from "../Service/NotificationService";
import { IconPencil, IconTrash } from "@tabler/icons-react";

const BlogPage = () => {
  const [opened, { open, close }] = useDisclosure(false);
  const [blogs, setBlogs] = useState([]);
  const [editMode, setEditMode] = useState(false);
  const [data, setData] = useState({
    id: null,
    picture: "",
    heading: "",
    description: "",
  });

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchBlogs();
  }, []);

  const fetchBlogs = async () => {
    try {
      const data = await getAllBlogs();
      setBlogs(data);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error("Error fetching blogs:", error);
    }
  };

  const handleChange = (event) => {
    setData({ ...data, [event.target.name]: event.target.value });
  };

  const handleEdit = (post) => {
    setData(post);
    setEditMode(true);
    open();
  };

  const handleSubmit = async () => {
    try {
      if (editMode) {
        await updateBlog(data);
        successNotification("Blog Updated Successfully", "Success");
      } else {
        await addBlog(data);
        successNotification("Blog Added Successfully", "Success");
      }
      fetchBlogs();
      close();
    } catch (error) {
      errorNotification(editMode ? "Update Failed" : "Add Blog Failed", "Error");
    }
    setEditMode(false);
  };

  const handleDelete = async (id) => {
    try {
      await deleteBlog(id);
      successNotification("Blog Deleted Successfully", "Success");
      setBlogs(blogs.filter((blog) => blog.id !== id)); // Remove deleted blog from state
    } catch (error) {
      errorNotification("Delete Failed", "Error");
    }
  };

  const handleFileChange = (image) => {
    if (!image) return;

    const reader = new FileReader();
    reader.readAsDataURL(image);
    reader.onloadend = () => {
      setData({ ...data, picture: reader.result });
    };
  };

  return (
    <div className="bg-[#0d0c1d]">
      {/* Hero Section */}
      <div className="py-20 text-white relative h-screen w-full flex items-center justify-center bg-gradient-to-r from-[#1f1233] via-[#2E1C47] to-[#3b2f4d]">
        <div
          className="absolute inset-0 bg-cover bg-center"
          style={{ backgroundImage: `url('Image/AboutBg.png')` }}
        >
          <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-black bg-opacity-5"></div>
        </div>
        <div className="w-[85%] mx-auto text-center relative z-10">
          <h2 className="text-5xl font-serif xs-mx:text-4xl">Blog</h2>
          <p className="text-lg text-gray-300 mt-4 max-w-2xl mx-auto">
            <BlurText text="The latest web industry press, technology innovations, events, and some helpful pointers from us!" />
          </p>
          <div className="absolute -bottom-36 left-1/2 transform -translate-x-1/2 text-[8rem] font-extrabold text-[#5b4974] opacity-20">
            TECHVISTRA
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>

      {/* Add Blog Button */}
      <Button
        onClick={() => {
          setEditMode(false);
          setData({ id: null, picture: "", heading: "", description: "" });
          open();
        }}
        variant="filled"
        fullWidth
        className="m-6 !w-28"
      >
        Add Blog
      </Button>

      {/* Blog Cards Section */}
      <div className="max-w-6xl mx-auto grid gap-6 md:grid-cols-3 px-6 py-10">
        {blogs.length > 0 ? (
          blogs.map((post) => (
            <div
              key={post.id}
              className="bg-gradient-to-r from-[#1e1e50] to-[#43436d] rounded-lg shadow-lg p-4 text-white border border-gray-700"
            >
              <img
                src={post.picture || "/images/default.png"}
                alt={post.heading}
                className="w-full h-40 object-cover rounded-md border border-gray-600"
              />
              <h2 className="text-xl font-semibold mt-4 text-[#E0B0FF]">
                {post.heading}
              </h2>
              <p className="text-gray-300 text-sm mt-2">{post.description}</p>
              <div className="flex justify-between mt-4">
                <IconPencil
                  className="cursor-pointer text-green-400"
                  onClick={() => handleEdit(post)}
                />
                <IconTrash
                  className="cursor-pointer text-red-500"
                  onClick={() => handleDelete(post.id)}
                />
              </div>
            </div>
          ))
        ) : (
          <p className="text-white text-center mt-4">No blogs available</p>
        )}
      </div>

      {/* Modal for Adding/Editing Blog */}
      <Modal
        opened={opened}
        onClose={close}
        radius="lg"
        title={editMode ? "Edit Blog" : "Add Blog"}
        centered
      >
        <div className="w-full max-w-md px-8 py-6 bg-white shadow-lg rounded-lg">
          <div className="font-semibold text-2xl text-center">
            {editMode ? "Edit Blog" : "Add Blog"}
          </div>

          <FileInput
            onChange={(file) => handleFileChange(file)}
            variant="filled"
            accept="image/png,image/jpeg"
            placeholder="Upload an image"
            className="mt-4"
          />

          <TextInput
            name="heading"
            value={data.heading}
            onChange={handleChange}
            withAsterisk
            label="Heading"
            placeholder="Enter Heading"
            className="mt-4"
          />
          <TextInput
            name="description"
            value={data.description}
            onChange={handleChange}
            withAsterisk
            label="Description"
            placeholder="Enter Description"
            className="mt-4"
          />

          <div className="flex justify-between mt-6">
            <Button onClick={handleSubmit} variant="filled">
              {editMode ? "Update Blog" : "Add Blog"}
            </Button>
            {editMode && (
              <Button color="red" onClick={() => handleDelete(data.id)}>
                Delete
              </Button>
            )}
          </div>
        </div>
      </Modal>
    </div>
  );
};

export default BlogPage;

Fixes & Improvements

Proper File Handling - Updates image properly in state.
Form Reset When Adding a New Blog - Ensures data is cleared.
Proper State Update on Delete - Blogs update correctly.
Better Error Handling - Catches and logs errors properly.

This should now work smoothly for adding, editing, and deleting blogs. Let me know if you need more fixes!

ChatGPT said:

The error you're seeing suggests that there is an issue with the base64 image encoding when sending the blog data to the backend.

Issues Identified:

  1. Illegal Base64 Character Exception

    • This happens when the image encoding is incorrect or improperly formatted before sending to the backend.
    • It might be due to missing or invalid padding (= characters in base64).
    • The data.picture might be holding the filename instead of the actual base64 string.

  2. Fetching Blogs Returns Empty ([])

    • Your API might require authentication, and it's failing due to missing or incorrect credentials.
    • Since it's logging "Login error", check if the user session or authentication token is correctly passed in the request.

Fixing the Image Encoding Issue

Ensure the uploaded image is correctly converted to a valid base64 string:

Modify handleFileChange

jsx
const handleFileChange = (file) => {
  if (!file) return;

  const reader = new FileReader();
  reader.readAsDataURL(file);
  reader.onload = () => {
    setData({ ...data, picture: reader.result.split(",")[1] }); // Extracting only the base64 part
  };
};
  • Why?
    The .split(",")[1] removes the unnecessary data:image/png;base64, part, sending only the valid base64 data.

Fixing the Authentication Issue

  1. Check API Authentication:

    • If your API requires authentication, ensure you're sending the token correctly:
    jsx
    const headers = {
  Authorization: `Bearer ${localStorage.getItem("token")}`, // Ensure the token is stored
  "Content-Type": "application/json",
};

  2. Verify If the User is Logged In:

    • If your backend requires login, make sure the user is authenticated before fetching or posting data.
    jsx
    useEffect(() => {
  const token = localStorage.getItem("token");
  if (!token) {
    errorNotification("Login Required", "Please log in first");
    return;
  }
  fetchBlogs();
}, []);

  3. Check Server Logs

    • Your backend might be rejecting unauthenticated requests.
    • Look at your Spring Boot backend logs to verify the exact cause.

Final Fixes

  • Ensure the correct base64 format is sent to the backend.
  • Check if the user is logged in before making API calls.
  • Debug by printing data.picture before sending it in handleSubmit: 
    jsx
    console.log("Base64 Image Data:", data.picture);

Your error "Illegal base64 character 3a" indicates that the image data is not being correctly encoded into base64 format before being sent to the backend.

Possible Issues & Fixes

1 Ensure Proper Base64 Encoding in React

Modify your file upload function to correctly extract base64 data:

jsx
const handleFileChange = (event) => {
  const file = event.target.files[0];
  if (!file) return;

  const reader = new FileReader();
  reader.readAsDataURL(file);
  reader.onload = () => {
    const base64String = reader.result.split(",")[1]; // Extract only base64 data
    setData((prevData) => ({ ...prevData, picture: base64String }));
    console.log("Base64 Image:", base64String); // Debugging
  };
  reader.onerror = (error) => {
    console.error("Error reading file:", error);
  };
};

Fix: This ensures that the base64 string does not contain "data:image/png;base64," prefix, which can cause issues.

2 Validate Backend Handling of Base64 String

Ensure that your Spring Boot backend is correctly decoding base64 strings:

java
import java.util.Base64;

public class BlogService {
    public void saveBlog(BlogDTO blogDTO) {
        try {
            byte[] imageBytes = Base64.getDecoder().decode(blogDTO.getPicture());
            // Save imageBytes in DB or process further
        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
            System.err.println("Invalid base64 format: " + e.getMessage());
        }
    }
}

Fix: This ensures that the backend properly decodes the base64 string without illegal characters.

3 Debug API Request in React

Modify your handleSubmit function to log the data before sending it:

jsx
const handleSubmit = () => {
  console.log("Submitting Data:", data); // Debugging

  addBlog(data)
    .then((res) => {
      console.log("Server Response:", res);
      successNotification("Blog Added Successfully", "Success");
      fetchBlogs();
      close();
    })
    .catch((err) => {
      console.error("Error Response:", err.response?.data || err);
      errorNotification("Add Blog Failed", "Error");
    });
};

Fix: This logs the exact data sent to the backend, so you can verify that the picture field contains valid base64.

Final Checklist

React correctly extracts base64 (without data:image/png;base64, prefix).
Backend properly decodes base64 using Base64.getDecoder().
Debug logs confirm valid data is sent to API.

ChatGPT said:

Error: "Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'files')"

This error occurs because the event object is not structured correctly when calling handleFileChange.

Fix: Update File Input Handler

Modify your handleFileChange function to correctly handle the file input:

jsx
const handleFileChange = (event) => {
  if (!event.target || !event.target.files || event.target.files.length === 0) {
    console.error("No file selected");
    return;
  }

  const file = event.target.files[0]; // Get the first file
  const reader = new FileReader();

  reader.onload = () => {
    const base64String = reader.result.split(",")[1]; // Remove data URL prefix
    setData((prevData) => ({ ...prevData, picture: base64String }));
  };

  reader.onerror = (error) => {
    console.error("File reading error:", error);
  };

  reader.readAsDataURL(file);
};

Other Things to Check

  1. Ensure the file input field exists and has onChange properly set up:

    jsx
    <input type="file" accept="image/*" onChange={handleFileChange} />

  2. Make sure the function is bound to the correct event.

    • If calling handleFileChange manually, ensure you pass the event correctly: 
      jsx
      <input type="file" onChange={(e) => handleFileChange(e)} />

Issues & Fixes in Your Code

Your React frontend is throwing an error:
Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'files')
This means the file input is not properly handled.

Your Spring Boot backend may also have issues processing images due to Base64 encoding/decoding. Let's fix both.

Fix: React Frontend - File Input Handling

Modify your handleFileChange function in BlogPage.jsx:

jsx
const handleFileChange = (event) => {
  const file = event.target?.files?.[0]; // Ensure file exists

  if (!file) {
    console.error("No file selected");
    return;
  }

  const reader = new FileReader();
  reader.readAsDataURL(file);

  reader.onload = () => {
    const base64String = reader.result.split(",")[1]; // Extract base64 string
    setData((prevData) => ({ ...prevData, picture: base64String }));
  };

  reader.onerror = (error) => {
    console.error("File reading error:", error);
  };
};

Changes made:

  • Added safe null checks (?. operator)
  • Used split(",")[1] to extract only Base64 data
  • Handled FileReader errors

Ensure your file input is correctly set up:

jsx
<input type="file" accept="image/*" onChange={handleFileChange} />

Fix: Spring Boot Backend - Base64 Decoding

In your updateBlog method, handle incorrect Base64 images properly:

java
@Override
public void updateBlog(BlogDTO blogDTO) throws TVException {
    Blog blog = blogRepository.findById(blogDTO.getId())
            .orElseThrow(() -> new TVException("Blog not found with id: " + blogDTO.getId()));

    blog.setHeading(blogDTO.getHeading());
    blog.setDescription(blogDTO.getDescription());

    if (blogDTO.getPicture() != null && !blogDTO.getPicture().isEmpty()) {
        try {
            byte[] decodedBytes = Base64.getDecoder().decode(blogDTO.getPicture());
            blog.setPicture(decodedBytes);
        } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
            throw new TVException("Invalid Base64 format for image"); // Custom exception handling
        }
    }

    blogRepository.save(blog);
}

Changes made:

  • Used byte[] decodedBytes = Base64.getDecoder().decode(blogDTO.getPicture());
  • Wrapped decoding in try-catch to handle invalid Base64 input
  • Throws a meaningful error if the Base64 is invalid

Next Steps

  1. Apply these changes & restart React + Spring Boot.
  2. Try uploading an image again.
  3. If the issue persists, check if the backend is receiving the image in the request.

It looks like you're facing an issue where the image is not being uploaded or processed correctly. Heres a step-by-step approach to fix it:

Issues Identified

  1. File Input Handling in React

    • Your handleFileChange function is not correctly receiving the file input when using FileInput from Mantine.
    • The onChange event does not directly pass event.target.files, but rather the file object itself.

  2. Incorrect Base64 Handling

    • In your backend, the BlogServiceImpl.getAllBlog() method is prefixing the image data with "data:image/png;base64,", while in the React frontend, you're splitting the Base64 string incorrectly when reading the file.

  3. File Input Not Being Read

    • The error "No file selected" in the console suggests that the file input is not properly handled.

Fixing the React Code

Modify your handleFileChange function in BlogPage.jsx as follows:

Updated handleFileChange function

javascript
const handleFileChange = (file) => {
  if (!file) {
    console.error("No file selected");
    return;
  }

  const reader = new FileReader();
  reader.onload = (event) => {
    const base64String = event.target.result.split(",")[1]; // Correctly extracting Base64
    setData((prevData) => ({ ...prevData, picture: base64String }));
  };

  reader.onerror = (error) => {
    console.error("File reading error:", error);
  };

  reader.readAsDataURL(file);
};

Fixes:

  • Now correctly extracts Base64 data from the file.
  • Works with Mantine FileInput component.

Fixing FileInput Component

Change your <FileInput> in Modal to:

jsx
<FileInput
  onChange={handleFileChange}
  accept="image/png,image/jpeg"
  placeholder="Upload an image"
  className="mt-4"
/>

Fixes:

  • This ensures that the correct file object is passed to handleFileChange.

Fixing the Backend Code

Modify getAllBlog() in BlogServiceImpl.java:

Updated getAllBlog Method

java
@Override
public List<BlogDTO> getAllBlog() {
    return blogRepository.findAll()
            .stream()
            .map(blog -> new BlogDTO(
                    blog.getId(),
                    blog.getPicture() != null ? Base64.getEncoder().encodeToString(blog.getPicture()) : null, // Removed extra "data:image/png;base64,"
                    blog.getHeading(),
                    blog.getDescription()))
            .collect(Collectors.toList());
}

Fixes:

  • Removes "data:image/png;base64," in the backend.
  • Ensures that only the correct Base64 image string is sent to React.

Final Steps

  1. Restart the backend server after making changes: 
    bash
    mvn clean install
mvn spring-boot:run
  2. Clear localStorage in React (if you're caching data).
  3. Refresh the page and test again.

ChatGPT said:

From your screenshot and the code provided, I can see the following issues:

1. Image Not Displaying Properly

Problem

  • Your img tag in the blog card section is using: 
    jsx
    <img src={`data:image/png;base64,${post.picture}`} alt={post.heading} />
  • However, from the console logs, the picture field in the fetched blogs seems to already contain the "data:image/png;base64," prefix.
  • This results in a double prefix, causing an invalid image source.

Solution

Modify your src value to avoid adding the prefix again:

jsx
<img
  src={post.picture.startsWith("data:image/") ? post.picture : `data:image/png;base64,${post.picture}`}
  alt={post.heading}
  className="w-full h-40 object-cover rounded-md border border-gray-600"
/>

Fixes

  • If post.picture already has the prefix, it uses it directly.
  • Otherwise, it adds the "data:image/png;base64," prefix.

2. "No File Selected" Error

Problem

  • You're using FileInput from Mantine, but the file object isn't being passed correctly.
  • The FileInput component calls onChange with a single file object, not an event.

Solution

Modify the handleFileChange function:

javascript
const handleFileChange = (file) => {
  if (!file) {
    console.error("No file selected");
    return;
  }

  const reader = new FileReader();
  reader.onload = (event) => {
    const base64String = event.target.result.split(",")[1]; // Extracting correct Base64
    setData((prevData) => ({ ...prevData, picture: base64String }));
  };

  reader.onerror = (error) => {
    console.error("File reading error:", error);
  };

  reader.readAsDataURL(file);
};

Fixes

  • Now correctly extracts the Base64 image.

3. Blog Deletion Error ("Row was updated or deleted by another transaction")

Problem

  • You're encountering a Hibernate OptimisticLockException, meaning:
    • The blog was updated/deleted in another transaction before your delete request was processed.
    • This often happens due to stale data in the frontend or transactions not committing properly.

Solution

In your Spring Boot backend, update your deleteBlog() method:

java
@Transactional
public void deleteBlog(Long id) {
    if (blogRepository.existsById(id)) {
        blogRepository.deleteById(id);
    } else {
        throw new EntityNotFoundException("Blog not found with id: " + id);
    }
}

Fixes

  • Uses existsById(id) to check if the blog still exists before deleting.
  • Avoids OptimisticLockException when the blog is already deleted.

Final Steps

  1. Restart the backend to apply the new transaction handling: 
    bash
    mvn clean install
mvn spring-boot:run
  2. Clear local storage/cache in React (localStorage.clear()).
  3. Test file uploads and deletions again.

Fixing Issues in Your Blog Management System

Based on your code and the console errors, heres how to fix your issues:

Issue 1: "Row was updated or deleted by another transaction" (Hibernate OptimisticLockException)

Problem

  • This happens when the row youre trying to delete has already been deleted or modified in another transaction before your delete request is processed.

Solution (Backend Fix - Spring Boot)

Modify your deleteBlog() method in your Spring Boot controller/service layer to handle this gracefully.

Before (Incorrect Approach)
java
@Transactional
public void deleteBlog(Long id) {
    blogRepository.deleteById(id);
}
After (Fix)
java
@Transactional
public void deleteBlog(Long id) {
    if (blogRepository.existsById(id)) {
        blogRepository.deleteById(id);
    } else {
        throw new EntityNotFoundException("Blog not found with id: " + id);
    }
}

Fixes

  • Now checks if the blog exists before deleting, preventing the OptimisticLockException.

Issue 2: Image Not Displaying Properly

Problem

  • Your Base64 image data might already contain the "data:image/png;base64," prefix.
  • You're adding this prefix again in your frontend.

Solution (Frontend Fix - ReactJS)

Modify your image rendering logic in BlogPage.js:

jsx
<img
  src={post.picture.startsWith("data:image/") ? post.picture : `data:image/png;base64,${post.picture}`}
  alt={post.heading}
  className="w-full h-40 object-cover rounded-md border border-gray-600"
/>

Fixes

  • This ensures that if post.picture already contains the prefix, it doesnt add it again.

Issue 3: File Upload (No File Selected error)

Problem

  • Your handleFileChange function is not correctly converting the file into Base64.

Solution (Frontend Fix - ReactJS)

Modify your handleFileChange() function:

javascript
const handleFileChange = (file) => {
  if (!file) {
    console.error("No file selected");
    return;
  }

  const reader = new FileReader();
  reader.onload = (event) => {
    const base64String = event.target.result.split(",")[1]; // Extracting correct Base64
    setData((prevData) => ({ ...prevData, picture: base64String }));
  };

  reader.onerror = (error) => {
    console.error("File reading error:", error);
  };

  reader.readAsDataURL(file);
};

Fixes

  • This correctly extracts Base64 and removes "data:image/png;base64," before storing.

Issue 4: Blog Not Updating in UI After Deletion

Problem

  • You're not immediately updating the UI when a blog is deleted.

Solution (Frontend Fix - ReactJS)

Modify your handleDelete() function:

javascript
const handleDelete = async (id) => {
  try {
    await deleteBlog(id);
    successNotification("Blog Deleted Successfully", "Success");

    // Remove the deleted blog from state
    setBlogs((prevBlogs) => prevBlogs.filter((blog) => blog.id !== id));
  } catch (error) {
    errorNotification("Delete Failed", "Error");
You said:
nooo i want to fix overlaping content look aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
ChatGPT said:

The overlapping content issue happens because the long text (like "AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA") is not wrapping correctly inside the blog card. You can fix this by updating your CSS styles.

Fix: Ensure Text Wrapping

Modify your blog card styles where the description is displayed:

jsx
<p className="text-gray-300 text-sm mt-2 break-words overflow-hidden text-ellipsis max-w-full">
  {post.description}
</p>

Explanation:

  • break-words: Forces long words to break and wrap to the next line.
  • overflow-hidden: Prevents content from overflowing outside the container.
  • text-ellipsis: Truncates text if it overflows (useful for limiting length).
  • max-w-full: Ensures it doesn't exceed the parent container width.

If the issue persists, ensure your parent container (div) also has overflow-hidden and a fixed max-width.

You said:
only show 5 line then .....
ChatGPT said:

You can limit the description to 5 lines and show "..." at the end using CSS line clamping. Here's how you can do it:

Solution: CSS Line Clamping

Modify your <p> tag inside the blog card:

jsx
<p className="text-gray-300 text-sm mt-2 line-clamp-5">
  {post.description}
</p>

Step 1: Add Tailwind's line-clamp-5 Class

If you're using Tailwind CSS, add the @tailwind line-clamp; in your tailwind.config.js under plugins:

js
module.exports = {
  content: ["./src/**/*.{js,jsx,ts,tsx}"],
  theme: {
    extend: {},
  },
  plugins: [require("@tailwindcss/line-clamp")],
};

Then, install the Tailwind plugin:

sh
npm install @tailwindcss/line-clamp

This will allow you to use line-clamp-5 in your JSX.

Alternative: Use Custom CSS

If you're not using Tailwind, apply this CSS in your stylesheet:

css
.line-clamp-5 {
  display: -webkit-box;
  -webkit-line-clamp: 5; /* Limits to 5 lines */
  -webkit-box-orient: vertical;
  overflow: hidden;
}

Then, add className="line-clamp-5" to your <p> tag.

Result:

Now, the blog description will only show 5 lines, and if the text is too long, it will end with "...".

ChatGPT said:

You can modify your BlogPage component to include useSelector from Redux to check if the user exists. If a user is logged in, show the "Add Blog" and "Edit Blog" buttons. Additionally, update the logic so that when clicking "Edit Blog", only the pencil icon appears for each blog.

Steps to Implement:

  1. Use useSelector to check if the user exists.
  2. Show Add/Edit buttons only if the user is logged in.
  3. When clicking "Edit Blog", only show the pencil icon.

Updated Code:

jsx
import React, { useEffect, useState } from "react";
import { useSelector } from "react-redux"; // Import useSelector
import BlurText from "../Components/Animation/BlurText";
import { Button, FileInput, Modal, TextInput } from "@mantine/core";
import { useDisclosure } from "@mantine/hooks";
import { addBlog, getAllBlogs, updateBlog, deleteBlog } from "../Service/BlogService";
import { errorNotification, successNotification } from "../Service/NotificationService";
import { IconPencil } from "@tabler/icons-react";

const BlogPage = () => {
  const [opened, { open, close }] = useDisclosure(false);
  const [blogs, setBlogs] = useState([]);
  const [editMode, setEditMode] = useState(false);
  const [showEditIcons, setShowEditIcons] = useState(false); // To toggle pencil icons
  const [data, setData] = useState({
    id: null,
    picture: "",
    heading: "",
    description: "",
  });

  // Get user from Redux store
  const user = useSelector((state) => state.auth.user);

  useEffect(() => {
    fetchBlogs();
  }, []);

  const fetchBlogs = async () => {
    try {
      const data = await getAllBlogs();
      setBlogs(data);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error("Error fetching blogs:", error);
    }
  };

  const handleChange = (event) => {
    setData({ ...data, [event.target.name]: event.target.value });
  };

  const handleEdit = (post) => {
    setData(post);
    setEditMode(true);
    open();
  };

  const handleSubmit = async () => {
    try {
      if (editMode) {
        await updateBlog(data);
        successNotification("Blog Updated Successfully", "Success");
      } else {
        await addBlog(data);
        successNotification("Blog Added Successfully", "Success");
      }
      fetchBlogs();
      close();
    } catch (error) {
      errorNotification(editMode ? "Update Failed" : "Add Blog Failed", "Error");
    }
    setEditMode(false);
  };

  const handleDelete = async (id) => {
    try {
      await deleteBlog(id);
      successNotification("Blog Deleted Successfully", "Success");
      setBlogs(blogs.filter((blog) => blog.id !== id)); // Remove deleted blog from state
    } catch (error) {
      errorNotification("Delete Failed", "Error");
    }
  };

  const handleFileChange = (file) => {
    if (!file) {
      console.error("No file selected");
      return;
    }

    const reader = new FileReader();
    reader.onload = (event) => {
      const base64String = event.target.result.split(",")[1]; // Correctly extracting Base64
      setData((prevData) => ({ ...prevData, picture: base64String }));
    };

    reader.onerror = (error) => {
      console.error("File reading error:", error);
    };

    reader.readAsDataURL(file);
  };

  return (
    <div className="bg-[#0d0c1d]">
      {/* Hero Section */}
      <div className="py-20 text-white relative h-screen w-full flex items-center justify-center bg-gradient-to-r from-[#1f1233] via-[#2E1C47] to-[#3b2f4d]">
        <div
          className="absolute inset-0 bg-cover bg-center"
          style={{ backgroundImage: `url('Image/AboutBg.png')` }}
        >
          <div className="absolute inset-0 bg-black bg-opacity-5"></div>
        </div>
        <div className="w-[85%] mx-auto text-center relative z-10">
          <h2 className="text-5xl font-serif xs-mx:text-4xl">Blog</h2>
          <p className="text-lg text-gray-300 mt-4 max-w-2xl mx-auto">
            <BlurText text="The latest web industry press, technology innovations, events, and some helpful pointers from us!" />
          </p>
          <div className="absolute -bottom-36 left-1/2 transform -translate-x-1/2 text-[8rem] font-extrabold text-[#5b4974] opacity-20">
            TECHVISTRA
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>

      {/* Show Add/Edit buttons only if user exists */}
      {user && (
        <div className="flex gap-4 justify-center mt-6">
          <Button
            onClick={() => {
              setEditMode(false);
              setData({ id: null, picture: "", heading: "", description: "" });
              open();
            }}
            variant="filled"
            className="!w-28"
          >
            Add Blog
          </Button>

          <Button
            onClick={() => setShowEditIcons(!showEditIcons)}
            variant="filled"
            className="!w-28"
          >
            Edit Blog
          </Button>
        </div>
      )}

      {/* Blog Cards Section */}
      <div className="max-w-6xl mx-auto grid gap-6 md:grid-cols-3 px-6 py-10">
        {blogs.length > 0 ? (
          blogs.map((post) => (
            <div
              key={post.id}
              className="bg-gradient-to-r from-[#1e1e50] to-[#43436d] rounded-lg shadow-lg p-4 text-white border border-gray-700"
            >
              <img
                src={post.picture.startsWith("data:image/") ? post.picture : `data:image/png;base64,${post.picture}`}
                alt={post.heading}
                className="w-full h-40 object-cover rounded-md border border-gray-600"
              />

              <h2 className="text-xl font-semibold mt-4 text-[#E0B0FF]">
                {post.heading}
              </h2>
              <p className="text-gray-300 text-sm mt-2 line-clamp-5 break-words overflow-hidden">
                {post.description}
              </p>

              {/* Show edit icon only if edit mode is active */}
              {showEditIcons && (
                <div className="flex justify-end mt-4">
                  <IconPencil
                    className="cursor-pointer text-green-400"
                    onClick={() => handleEdit(post)}
                  />
                </div>
              )}
            </div>
          ))
        ) : (
          <p className="text-white text-center mt-4">No blogs available</p>
        )}
      </div>

      {/* Modal for Adding/Editing Blog */}
      <Modal
        opened={opened}
        onClose={close}
        radius="lg"
        title={editMode ? "Edit Blog" : "Add Blog"}
        centered
      >
        <div className="w-full max-w-md px-8 py-6 bg-white shadow-lg rounded-lg">
          <div className="font-semibold text-2xl text-center">
            {editMode ? "Edit Blog" : "Add Blog"}
          </div>

          <FileInput
            onChange={handleFileChange}
            accept="image/png,image/jpeg"
            placeholder="Upload an image"
            className="mt-4"
          />

          <TextInput
            name="heading"
            value={data.heading}
            onChange={handleChange}
            withAsterisk
            label="Heading"
            placeholder="Enter Heading"
            className="mt-4"
          />
          <TextInput
            name="description"
            value={data.description}
            onChange={handleChange}
            withAsterisk
            label="Description"
            placeholder="Enter Description"
            className="mt-4"
          />

          <div className="flex justify-between mt-6">
            <Button onClick={handleSubmit} variant="filled">
              {editMode ? "Update Blog" : "Add Blog"}
            </Button>
          </div>
        </div>
      </Modal>
    </div>
  );
};

export default BlogPage;

Features Implemented:

Uses useSelector to check if the user exists.
Shows "Add Blog" and "Edit Blog" buttons only for logged-in users.
Toggles pencil icons when "Edit Blog" is clicked.
Handles modal form for adding/updating blogs.

Let me know if you need further refinements!

If the "Add Blog" and "Edit Blog" buttons are visible even when the user is not in Redux, it means useSelector((state) => state.auth.user) is returning a value, or the component isn't correctly checking for the user's presence.

Troubleshooting Steps:

  1. Check Redux State in DevTools:

    • Open Redux DevTools in Chrome.
    • Look at the auth slice and see if user exists.

  2. Add a Console Log to Verify the User: Add this inside BlogPage.js:

    jsx
    const user = useSelector((state) => state.auth.user);
console.log("Redux User:", user);
    • If it logs null or undefined, but the buttons are still showing, there's a logical error.

  3. Modify the Conditional Rendering: Ensure your condition is strict:

    jsx
    {user !== null && user !== undefined && (
  <div className="flex gap-4 justify-center mt-6">
    <Button onClick={open} variant="filled" className="!w-28">
      Add Blog
    </Button>
    <Button onClick={() => setShowEditIcons(!showEditIcons)} variant="filled" className="!w-28">
      Edit Blog
    </Button>
  </div>
)}
    • This ensures buttons only show when user is defined.

  4. Check Local Storage:

    • Your screenshot shows Local Storage is empty. If you're storing the user in local storage and loading it into Redux, that process might be failing.
    • Verify if the login persists the user state properly.

  5. Check if Redux Store is Resetting:

    • Try refreshing the page and see if user still exists.
    • If it disappears, the Redux store might not be persisting across refreshes.

I see you're still troubleshooting why the "Add Blog" and "Edit Blog" buttons are visible even when no user is logged in. Your BlogPage.js is using:

js
const user = useSelector((state) => state.user);

Issues in Your Code:

  1. Incorrect Redux State Path

    • Redux state is often structured as: 
      js
      state.auth.user
    • Your code uses state.user, but if your state is actually structured as auth: { user: ... }, then user might always be undefined.

  2. Check Redux DevTools

    • Open Chrome Redux DevTools and check:
      • What does state look like?
      • Is user stored inside auth?
      • If yes, update the selector: 
        js
        const user = useSelector((state) => state.auth.user);

  3. Add Console Logging

    • Before the conditional rendering, log the user: 
      js
      console.log("User from Redux:", user);
    • This will confirm if user is null, undefined, or still contains data.

  4. Persisted State Issue

    • Your Local Storage is empty in the screenshot.
    • If you rely on Redux for authentication but do not persist it in localStorage, Redux resets on page refresh.
    • Try implementing Redux persist: 
      js
      import { persistReducer } from "redux-persist";
import storage from "redux-persist/lib/storage";

const persistConfig = {
  key: "root",
  storage,
};

const persistedReducer = persistReducer(persistConfig, rootReducer);
    • Wrap Redux store with persistStore.

Next Steps

  • Check Redux State in DevTools.
  • Update useSelector to match your store structure.
  • Add console logging to confirm what user contains.
  • Consider persisting Redux state.

ChatGPT said:

The error "Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'user')" suggests that your Redux state is missing the user object or that you are trying to access user from an undefined part of the state.

How to Fix It

1. Check Your Redux State Structure

  • Open the Redux DevTools in your browser.
  • Go to the State tab and inspect whether user is inside state.auth or state.user.

2. Modify Your useSelector Hook

Your current selector:

js
const user = useSelector((state) => state.user);

If your user is inside auth, change it to:

js
const user = useSelector((state) => state.auth?.user);

This ensures auth exists before accessing user.

3. Provide a Default Value

If user is undefined, it can cause an error when accessing properties like user.role. Use optional chaining (?.) or provide a default:

js
const user = useSelector((state) => state.auth?.user) || {};

4. Debug with console.log

Before rendering, check if user is defined:

js
console.log("User from Redux:", user);

5. Ensure Redux State Persistence

Your Local Storage is empty, meaning the state resets on refresh. If you're using Redux without persistence, add redux-persist:

js
import { persistReducer } from "redux-persist";
import storage from "redux-persist/lib/storage";

const persistConfig = {
  key: "root",
  storage,
};

const persistedReducer = persistReducer(persistConfig, rootReducer);

Then wrap your store with persistStore.

Next Steps

  • Check Redux DevTools to confirm where user is stored.
  • Update useSelector to match your state structure.
  • Log user to verify its value.
  • Consider using Redux Persist for persistence.

js

2. Add Global CSS for Mantine Notifications

In your App.css, add this:

css
.mantine-Notifications-root {

This forces the notification to stay at the top.

  • Inspect the notification element
  • See if any CSS styles are setting bottom: 0 or similar
